page.title: 09IN THE PLAYGROUND
page.content: "Granny's in the kitchen, Doing a bit of stitching, How many stitches did she do? 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, ....." This is a skipping rhyme. It is sung in the playground. We see all sorts of games in the playground, such as football, runouts, kings and queens, transformers and off-the-ground-touch. We asked a few school cooks what games were played when they were at school. A game we hadn't heard of was called { {'KEYSEY',}se we asked how to paly it. You need large keys and 4 squares separated. You would have to flick a key into each square. If a key is already there you can flick it off the square with your own key.
